greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest multiple of n using only digits 0 and 6.
comment: a(n) = min{A204093(k): k > 0 and A204093(k) mod n = 0}. [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 10 2012]
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: With[{c=Rest[FromDigits/@Tuples[{0,6},10]]},Table[SelectFirst[c,Divisible[ #,n]&],{n,50}]] (* The program uses the SelectFirst function from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 15 2015 *)
program: a078245 n = head [x | x <- tail a204093_list, mod x n == 0]
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Nov 23 2002
